author: Mark Jones
title: Newcastle fan 'had no choice' but to run onto the pitch at Huddersfield - because his tattoo was hurting
text:
Dwight Gayle has got a lot to answer for (Photo: Getty Images / Huddersfield Examiner) Share Get daily     
As excuses go, this is a pretty good one. 
Newcastle United fan Reece Smailes has pleaded guilty to a charge of entering the playing area during the Magpies' clash at Huddersfield earlier this month, but he claims that he had a pretty good reason to. 
Smailes and the other travelling Geordies went wild when Dwight Gayle scored in stoppage time to seal Newcastle's 3-1 win , and in the celebrations he ended up with his belly pressed up against a barrier. 
And, as you'll notice in the picture below, he's got something rather special on his belly. This is quite the tattoo (Photo: UGC HDE) Reece will be entering the pitch right about now (Photo: PhotoEye.co.uk) 
Smailes' newly-inked tattoo started to become sore when in contact with the barrier, so he claims he had no choice but to vault over it and spill out onto the pitch. 
As reported by the Huddersfield Examiner , the 24-year-old - who received a football banning order for punching a fan in 2011 - wasn't issued with another order, but the court have ordered him to pay a £484 fine, as well as £85 court costs and a £32 victim surcharge. Reece (seen here on the right) has seriously upgraded his tattoo from this effort (Photo: Internet unknown) 
Rachel Sharpe, mitigating, told magistrates: “The defendant was being shoved up against the barrier and then jumped over it to prevent discomfort having had a new tattoo. 
“He ran towards the pitch but stopped himself before entering the pitch. 
“This was in the last minute of the game when Newcastle scored and he was celebrating. 
“He didn’t encroach into the pitch as he knows he shouldn’t and was quickly apprehended.” poll loading Have you got the name of your team tattooed on you? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
